alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 11 at 2:10AM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .Another in a series of storm systems will bring another period of moderate to occasionally heavy rainfall to the area today and tonight. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Mendocino County, Lake County, Trinity County, Southern Humboldt Interior, and Southwestern Humboldt. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
